bug.short_desc: Improve client detection for Google Chrome

long_desc.thetext: At the moment it isn't possible to detect the Google Chrome browser.
We should first fix the issue #1810 before we improve the client detection for Google Chrome.

Google Chrome is webkit. The engine detection has no need to separate them. 4 engines is really enough. We also need this limit for variants etc. Google Chrome is a browser and should be therefor detected by some kind of browser detection instead.
I would like to suggest a qx.bom.client.Browser which adds info about this:
Google Chrome Safari Internet Explorer Maxthon (major IE alternative in China) Firefox Flock (Social Firefox alternative) etc.
Not sure if this should also contain the browser version so we can ask for "Firefox 3.0" instead of gecko-1.9.

@Daniel, please look into this, collaborating with Chris.
Besides the simple "information" about the browser, is a Chrome detection needed anywhere within the framework (Chris)? This shouldn't really be required IMHO.
Chrome is a browser like Firefox. The browser detection should support Chrome as well. This is nothing for the Engine class though.

I'm not sure, but I think Jonny has applied a fix for Chrome in a framework class. So a detection is therefore needed.
Sebastian, I agree, that the detection could done in a other class. So I change the title to "Improve client detection for Google Chrome"
